Jo Lynn is a certified 'go-getter' and a woman who seeks to leave an impact on society with her new company, XOXY.comI had the pleasure of interviewing Ms. Clemens on my talk radio podcast program in December 2015, and I thoroughly enjoyed how intelligent, insightful, and articulate this young lady was.  Ms. Clemens is not phony, pretentious, and/or prudish in any respect.  She is totally down-to-earth, relatable, and easy to converse with.If anyone is looking to interview Ms. Clemens about her company, XOXY.com, or someone is looking to form a partnership or execute a collaboration with Ms. Clemens and her company, they will not be disappointed in any way with her professionalism and her vision for the future.I recommend Ms. Clemens highly as a television guest and/or talk radio guest, as well as being a potential business colleague, partner, or collaborator.

Troy Broussard
Partner at Allen & Gooch, A Law Corporation
September 22, 2014, Jo Lynn was a client of Troy’s

As an attorney specializing in insurance coverage and insurance defense matters, I have had the honor and pleasure of knowing and working closely with Jo Lynn Clemens for over ten years. To any situation, Jo Lynn not only brings a very high level of professionalism, work ethic and competence, but an unwaivering commitment to reaching the desired goal. Time and time again, Jo Lynn has proven herself to be a natural leader and problem-solver with a very broad range of experience, both personally and professionally. She is highly effective at handling conflict and has the ability to  give attention to detail while maintaining vision of the "big picture." I have witnessed firsthand how Jo Lynn commands the respect of her colleagues, associates and subordinates, and she has the rare ability to inspire. Yet, perhaps my favorite characteristic of Jo Lynn is her delightful personality that brings people together and brings out the best in those around her.

summary: Post employment risk can destroy a company's reputation and profits. I've Been Vetted mitigates future risks ahead of the storm.One out of three Americans have a criminal record and pre-employment checks miss the majority of convictions (due to delay in court recording). The average negligent hiring judgment is  $1.6 million as judges no longer view pre-employment checks as sufficient vetting.  Experience includes; CEO and Founder of XOXY, President of JJC Insurance Services, LLC, an insurance training, compliance and operational auditing company monitoring coverholders in the areas of; Compliance, IT, Marketing, Accounting, Underwriting and Claims on behalf of Lloyds of London and Claims Manager for Mesa Underwriters Specialty Insurance Company, managing both budgets of over $5,000,000 and personnel. In 2010 she was invited as a Delegate Ambassador to China on behalf of the Society of Chartered Property and Casualty Underwriters (CPCU). As a Delegate she met with the Dean of Peking University, Executives of Chartis Insurance Group and Executives from the government controlled People’s Insurance Company of China (PICC) to exchange ideas on business methodology and expansion. Leadership positions include; Director of Regulation and Legislation for AZ Society of CPCU, Regional Chair for Claims Litigation Management organization, Secretary of the Omaha Chapter of CPCU, Executive Board Member for Sickle Cell Anemia and Regulatory Delegate of the Advisory Board for Disability Prevention. Editorial Assistant of the Journal of Applied Social Sciences at Case Western Reserve University.Ms. Clemens has chaired risk management panels entitled, “Managing Risk-Snow and Ice Litigation” , " Medicare Lien Settlements", "Reservation of Rights Issues" at the Annual CLM Conferences and co-authored articles; “Binding or Not- Arbitration Clauses in Construction Contracts”, "Managing Snow and Ice Litigation " and "Common Medicare Settlement Bottlenecks and Proposed Solutions."
name: Jo Lynn Clemens, CPCU, ARM
title: CEO and Founder at I've Been Vetted
